DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text and/or numeric identifier for a preparation of tissue cells preserved and mounted on a glass slide for microscopic study that has been processed by a cytospin centrifuge.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features._Process of using a rotating machine to generate centrifugal force to separate substances of different densities, remove moisture, or simulate gravitational effects. It employs a large motor-driven apparatus with a long arm, at the end of which human and animal subjects, biological specimens, or equipment can be revolved and rotated at various speeds to study gravitational effects. (From Websters, 10th ed; McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 4th ed)_A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study._Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.:Process of using a rotating machine to generate centrifugal force to separate substances of different densities, remove moisture, or simulate gravitational effects. It employs a large motor-driven apparatus with a long arm, at the end of which human and animal subjects, biological specimens, or equipment can be revolved and rotated at various speeds to study gravitational effects. (From Websters, 10th ed; McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 4th ed):A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.

A process where a rotating machine exposes a specimen to centrifugal force. This process can be used to remove moisture from a specimen, to subject an organism to increased gravitational forces, or to separate the components of heterogeneous mixtures based on density differences.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Property.preferredDefinition: Submission; a message submitted for the judgment of others.

Concepts.definition: Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.
